programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in Cumbria, enjoying one of the most spectacular coastal railway journeys in Britain. In Ulverston, he sets sail in a small craft with a lifelong devotee of Arthur Ransome's Swallows and Amazons. At Barrow-in-Furness, Michael investigates the mountains of scrap left behind as iron ore was turned into ships, trains and railway tracks. From Silecroft, Michael hikes up Black Combe to join a champion endurance athlete as she navigates and runs across the fells. Pressing north, he reaches the delightful Ravenglass and Eskdale heritage railway.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie takes on Chris to create a low-carbon, family friendly garden

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team are in London to help a single mum of three reclaim her bedroom and get her young daughters back in their own beds. With just 24 hours, and a minimal budget, they must declutter, makeover and clean their bedroom, and come up with clever storage solutions for their toys.

programme.title: A Special School
programme.desc: A big show, a bigger water fight and prom - the summer term is here.

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A prolific gang stealing expensive catalytic converters from underneath cars pick the wrong street to operate in. A takeaway owner faces down a gunman, and police hunting a fugitive get unexpected help from a herd of cows.

programme.title: Nicky Campbell BBC News Talk
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell takes your calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 between 9am and 11am on weekdays (calls are free from mobiles and landlines).

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A suivre, les dernières actualités présentées par les équipes rédactionnelles de la BBC, le très réputé radiodiffuseur du service public britannique. Créée en 1922 à Londres, la British Broadcast Corporation est connue pour être la plus ancienne société diffusant des programmes de radio ou de télévision au monde.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Entertaining and educational British quiz show, hosted by Rick Edwards, where 24 regular contestants compete throughout the series to answer tricky questions. But some of the optional answers are designed to be ''impossible'', or at the very least inconsistent with the information given. The participants must avoid selecting these booby trap answer and the best one wins the £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Teams from all over the UK battle to beat the formidable Eggheads.

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: James Martin explores why Lincolnshire is famed for its world-class pork and perfect peas.

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Gethin Jones delivers the ultimate guide to a countryside summer featuring wildlife, food, gardening and outdoor adventure, all brought to you by a selection of favourite faces. In this episode, Nadiya Hussain learns all about garlic and shows us how to make a delicious garlic dressing, Arit Anderson gets a tour of landscape designer Dan Pearson's private garden, and Chris Packham and Megan McCubbin share a special encounter with dolphins.

programme.title: What Britain Buys and Sells in a Day
programme.desc: Saison 1 Episode 2 Ed Balls, Ade Adepitan and Cherry Healey look at seafood. Année de réalisation : 2019

programme.title: Back in Time for the Corner Shop
programme.desc: This time the family are running a shop through the 1970s. By now the supermarkets have become Britain's shopping destination of choice and corner shops started to feel the pinch. Most small shops followed the supermarkets' lead and became almost completely self-service. In 1972 comedian Sanjeev Kohli visits the Arderns to discuss how Asian corner shops started to become commonplace in the UK.

programme.title: Flog It !
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Norwich Cathedral in Norfolk. In the great nave, experts Thomas Plant and David Fletcher pick out some choice items to take to auction. Among them are a masonic watch and a much sought-after commemorative mug by Eric Ravilious. Paul also visits the extravagant home of Britain's first prime minister, Robert Walpole.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Edith Bowman, Fern Brady, Will Kirk and Martin Lewis face more trivia questions.

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey in the pretty seaside resort of Hornsea, famous for its distinctive pottery. In Hull, he discovers how one of Hull FC's star players made history as Britain's first black rugby captain. From Hull, Michael hitches a ride on a fine-looking barge heading to Goole on a network of canals. At Spurn Point, Michael hears how along this coast an ingenious 19th-century RNLI invention saved many lives. And aboard the Pride of the Humber, the biggest all-weather lifeboat in the fleet, Michael is permitted to take the helm.

programme.title: Today at the Test: England v India
programme.sub-title: First Test: Day One Highlights England v Ireland
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Week one of Springwatch wraps up with a deluge of drama.

programme.title: Strike: Inside the Unions
programme.desc: Following the escalation of the biggest workers' movement in a generation. Amazon workers in Coventry are to hold the UK's first strike for the global business giant, and Pat Cullen from the Royal College of Nurses comes to the fore as the nurses' dispute with the government faces supreme challenges.

programme.title: Inside No. 9
programme.desc: Saison 7 Episode 2 Alan arrives to teach at a small school in rural Wales but finds himself overshadowed. Année de réalisation : 2022

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: In-depth news and current affairs review of the main political and economic stories of the day, featuring robust interviews with senior government and opposition figures, business and trade union leaders.

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: As firefighters attempt to get a major fire at a Birmingham factory under control, fire investigator Luke Beckett is deployed to investigate before vital evidence is destroyed by the blaze. With no natural sources of ignition, Luke thinks that the fire may have been started deliberately, and a police investigation is launched. Although no forensic leads are found in the wreckage, in a stroke of luck the factory's CCTV room is left intact after the fire. The police and Luke Beckett have to work together to investigate whether this was a deliberate act, a reckless act of arson or something else altogether.

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: The dangers of a dodgy hair transplant, and do you really feed a cold and starve a fever?

programme.title: Strike: Inside the Unions
programme.desc: State of the Unions

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: In this episode, we see the devastating consequences of a lorry driver taking his eyes off the road to scroll through his mobile phone. His vehicle ploughs into a line of queuing traffic, killing four people. The incident is captured on his dashcam. This programme, narrated by Rav Wilding, looks at how cameras fitted with artificial intelligence software are being used to detect when a driver is using their mobile phone. These cameras are being trialled on UK roads and the hope is that they will help change driver behaviour and ultimately prevent more lives being lost. In this episode, we also see how dedicated police teams equipped with night-vision kits are taking on criminals who prey on isolated rural communities.

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams sees rare birds, insects and lizards along the north-east Wales border.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: This is BBC Two.
